other_tests.findings: Cold abscess developed at the vaccination site, unnoticed initially, later presented as a subcutaneous nodule with a ruptured lesion, showing acute and chronic inflammatory infiltrate.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initially treated surgically, then conservatively; the lesion improved on nonsurgical therapy without antituberculosis medication.

other_tests.findings: A large subcutaneous granuloma with a buried staple was found during surgery, excised along with infiltrated tissue.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative healing was reported without signs of recurrence.

other_tests.findings: Negative pressure was maintained successfully using a weight-loaded syringe, resulting in effective wound healing.
other_tests.changes_over_time: All patients showed comparable outcomes to those treated with conventional vacuum pumps.

other_tests.findings: Facilitates safe and effective intramuscular dissection by preventing muscle contraction and spasms during surgery.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Decreased complications associated with dissecting procedures where muscle twitching was an issue.
